StringLiteralExpr.value: \nDemo program for GENERATING SPIKE TRAINS WITH SPECIFIED CORRELATIONS, Macke et al.\n
Step 1: Generating correlated binary variables (section 2.1)
Target mean X1: %.2f Estimated mean X1: %.3f\n
Target mean X2: %.2f Estimated mean X2: %.3f\n
Target cov X1X2: %.2f Estimated cov X1X2: %.3f\n
To proceed to compare histograms, hit any key...
Step 2: Effect of correlations
P(X) in independent model
P(X) in DG model
Step 2: What effect do correlations have?
To proceed to generate Poisson RVs, hit any key...
Step 3: Correlated Poisson from a binary process (3.1)
Target mean X1: %.2f Estimated mean X1: %.3f\n
Target mean X2: %.2f Estimated mean X2: %.3f\n
Target cov X1X2: %.2f Estimated cov X1X2: %.3f\n
To plot the marginals and joint histogram, hit any key...
X_1 Poisson
X_2 Poisson
Step 3: Correlated Poisson, Positive Correlation\nMarginal Distributions with Poisson\n distribution with correct mean
To proceed to positively correlated Poisson variables with another method, hit any key...
